intro: Hieracium pseudonanodes, commonly known as the dwarf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in dense clusters, often blooming from June to August. Hieracium pseudonanodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
